conversations.content: Hinomoto Before Seimei Left for Alberia
*deep breath*
O that which shines like the durn sun! I beseech ya, release yer light'n make manifest its brilliance! Onmyo! Haaaah!
*cough* Well, heck. That ain't no good...
Stupid fox! How many times are you going to screw this up? Why did you detonate the jufu talisman all the way over there?
Sorry, master—but hey, least it went better'n last time! I got a bright future, I just knows it!
A bold statement from a blockhead who can't do anything on her own.
The cuss did ya just call me?!
Are your ears just for show as well? I called you a blockhead who can't do anything on her own.
What's going on here?
Hey, I'm doing m'darndest to be a good assistant for ya!
And failing miserably. All you do is make MORE work for me, not less.
(Oh. They're fighting again.)
That ain't true no how! Just 'cause I mess up more'n the average fox don't mean I'm good for nothin' at all!
Then can you at least leave this room on your own, or must I order you to undertake that action as well?
Oh, if ya want me gone, I'm goner than a hog's slop bucket a minute after supper! Just don't come cryin' to me what when ya realize what ya done, 'cause I am OUT!
Are you certain about this?
Hmph. This is nothing new; she'll come crawling back as soon as she's hungry.
*sigh*
*sniff* Curse that sourpuss of a man... Don't he realize the whole POINT'a trainin' is so ya can fail and learn?
What?! Another one?!
What'n the hey is that about?
It's the third sudden disappearance in town just this month. The young girl of the family who runs Bizenya.
Alas, we've a kidnapper in our midst! What are the authorities doing about it?
I fear they are already stretched quite thin, and mostly focused on more obvious sorts of crimes that are easier to identify.
Like that weird ＂Mukuroshu＂ bunch that have been causing trouble lately.
How horrid! I'm heading home right now before I become the next victim!
If you like, I'd be happy to escort you.
Pass. I'd rather risk a kidnapping.
Ooof! Ice cold...
The Mukuroshu is that group Lord Seimei was ordered to pursue! Sounds like they're getting up to heaps'a mischief here...
Reckon he mentioned to me 'bout how they were abductin' folks what to conduct experiments with Yomi chi, so...
Hot dang! That gives me a dilly of an idea!
If I solve this all on m'own, Lord Seimei can't be callin' me useless no more!
Heck, just findin' the Mukuroshu base or the kidnapped folks or somethin' like that will probably be good enough.
All right! Time to start sniffin' around town for some dang evildoers!
Can't wait to see the look'a frustration on his face... This is one fox he's gonna regret pokin' fun at, boy howdy!
(Hot bowl'a oatmeal! Can't believe I went and found a suspicious sort so darn quick! This here's even better'n I'd hoped...)
Whoa! Watch it!
Whoops! Sorry, I was in a hur... Wait, Lady Mitsuhide?! THE Lady Mitsuhide?!
Oh, right. You work for Seimei. It's, er, Kuzunoha or...something?
Oy! Who's there?!
Aw, horse nuggets! We gotta hide!
Come out! I know you're there!
*yip yip yip*
Bah. Just another wild fox.
I can't believe that worked...
I heard rumors Seimei was in this area— I assume the two of you are also trying to chase down the Mukuroshu?
Nope! This here's all me.
Huh? He didn't, like, order you to do it?
(C'mon. There's no WAY he'd leave a mission like this to an idiot like her!)
Mind if we hoof it while we talk? I can't lose sight'a them Mukuroshu types if'n I wanna get revenge on Lord Seimei.
Uh, sure, all right. Lead the way. (She is SO gonna screw this up...)
...So basically you want to find who's responsible for these disappearances so you can make Seimei feel bad for saying terrible things about you?
That's it, all right! What about yerself?
I'm after the same thing—er, though not exactly for the same reason. I just want to bring peace back to the land, y'know?
Anyway, that's why I've been walking around keeping my eyes peeled for anyone suspicious. Only seems right, what with this being part of my territory and all.
Hoo-eee! And here I heard ya didn't have time for nothin' but slackin' off!
Hard to slack off when the world is on fire.
Plus everybody else who could do something is out on even bigger threats.
What threats're those?
Don't worry your fuzzy head about it. How about we just work together here since we're after the same thing?
Unlike Seimei, no one's ordered me to look into the Mukuroshu—I just hate 'em stirring up trouble in my territory.
Reckon I'm gonna pass.
Wait, what? Why? Two people can solve this thing twice as fast, right?
Yer head of a Wyrmclan just like Lord Seimei, which means yer his rival what to be the next shogun.
And you think I'm going to try and steal all the glory to help me with that?
I'll tell you a secret, fox: I couldn't give one whit about that stupid job.
Ain't about what YOU think— it's about what Lord Seimei thinks.
Ah, and you think he'll hate knowing that I helped him with a problem he sees as his own? ...Yeah, okay. That's fair.
Yep! Ya hit that mouse right on the noggin'! Er, hope that don't offend ya none.
Plus, I can't be showin' him how wrong he is 'bout my talent and usefulness if'n I get help from every darn passin' hand!
If I don't do this all on m'lonesome, he ain't never gonna ask me to stay.
No, that all makes sense—but can you REALLY do this by yourself?
Heeeey! What're ya implyin' there?!
Just that you're clearly not cut out for... You know what? This isn't my business. Good luck byeeeeee!
Oof. She really knows how to hit a fox right in the ol' snout...
Not a secret I ain't cut out for this whole ＂trailin' folk＂ business.
But I wanna be useful—and if I can do somethin' good on m'own, Lord Seimei's sure to praise me heaps!
Which means I gotta hop back on the mule and find the Mukuroshu's trail!
Can't believe they made a base inside a cave like this. Better take me a gander...
(Sweet potato pie! That's gotta be one'a the folks what went and got kidnapped! I KNEW the Mukuroshu was behind this!)
Who's there?!
(Sheep dung! They got me!)
Tsk! Just the wind. I really gotta find a more low-key line of work...
Whew! That was close. But it's sure as heck good to see ya, Lady Mitsuhide! How long ya been here?
Oh, for quite a while now. But since you made it PERFECTLY clear that you wanted to work alone, I tried to stay hidden.
Well then, I owe ya twice over for savin' me. Thought I was gonna be pushin' up pretty flowers there for a tick.
Think nothing of it. If you'd been found, my hard work would've been for nothing.
Still, it means I didn't find the darn Mukuroshu base on m'own after all.
Sure you did! I just got here first.
That's a real bum steer of a prize there...
Anyway, I'd hurry back to Seimei and fill him in on all of this if I were you.
The Mukuroshu don't stay in one place for very long, you know?
And if you don't hurry, this hideout's gonna be empty before he can even get here.
I appreciate the warnin', but I can take 'er from here. Lord Seimei's gonna have these folks handled a'fore ya can say 'boo'!
So I can just sit around and watch all the fun? Perfect.
We need to find our next abduction victim and start... Huh? What's that?
...A jufu? Heh. Looks like we've got Seimei's little shikigami on our tails.
Better let Master Doman know about this. Heh heh... Bring it on, Seimei!
Got it. I'll take care of the Mukuroshu before they move their base.
If you insist on coming, knock yourself out—but don't expect me to watch your back for even a second.
Now just a corn-shuckin' minute! That ain't no way to talk to me what after everything I just did!
The only reason ya even know where that darn base IS is 'cause I went'n found it!
So I reckon ya could at least PRETEND to be gratefu... Huh? Where'd he go?
Dangnabbit, he's gone and left me! Lord Seimei, waaaaait!
So that's their base, eh? I hope you remembered to bring your jufu.
'Course I did! Heck, I went'n brought, uh, one...two...three...49 of 'em!
You know 49 is an unlucky number, right? Anyway, to business. How many of them are waiting for us inside?
I only followed the one, so there's at least that many! Could be more, though.
So a number equal to or greater than one? *sigh* I'll just go look for myself.
O that which can see beyond the horizon! I beseech you, reveal our foes! Onmyo! Haaaah!
What did you just do?
Seeing how many people are in there. I count five, though that likely includes the woman you said they kidnapped.
So we only gotta take out four of 'em? Heck, this'll be easier than shovin' a muddy hog down a chute!
Back me up, master! I got this!
What are you...?! Ugh. Fine. Suit yourself, you stupid fox.
The jig's up, friends! Put them paws in the air and don't gimme no backtalk 'bout it!
Who the hell are you?!
(I see three of 'em and the one victim. Reckon that means the other kidnapper's somewhere further inside.)
Well, well. If it isn't Seimei's little dog come to us like a lamb to slaughter.
I ain't a dog OR a lamb! I'm a cute ol' fox!
You all right there, ma'am?
Who...are you?
I'm yer dang rescue party! Now stand back while I give these fools a thrashin'!
Well, heck! They look all weak and spindly, but they're faster'n greased geese!
Heh. If a shikigami like you is the best Seimei can do, it's clear the rumors of his greatness have been exaggerated.
The cuss did you say?!
Seimei is no match for our great Master Doman!
They went and got a shikigami!
And no ordinary shikigami—this one was granted to us by Master Doman, and is unparalleled in strength!
That's a darn dirty trick what to keep crammed up yer sleeves!
You can regret your foolishness in the depths of hell. Destroy her!
Now do you see why I told you not to run off alone, you useless fox?
Lord Seimei!
You protect the woman—I'll take care of this rabble here.
We've been waiting for you, Seimei. Master Doman won't even need to sully his hands, because we'll finish you off ourselves!
Hmph. You're going to need greater numbers than that to finish me.
Then how about...THIS?!
You can't handle this many on your own!
Aargh!
One weakling or a thousand, you're still mere weaklings, moron.
Gah! GET HIM!
Aaargh!
Hoo-eee! Pretty as a picture, Lord Seimei! But now I'm gonna back ya up with this here onmyodo of m'own!
O that which shines like the darn sun! I beseech ya, release yer light'n make—
Fool! You left yourself open!
Argh! When did YOU sneak up behind me?!
Give it up, Seimei!
Surrender, or it's the end for this little lady here.
Please don't kill me! Please!
Bah. What a mess.
It's all my dang fault. If I'd just been watchin' her like ya told me to...
*sigh* Run away.
Heck no! I ain't gonna just run and leave ya what to deal with all them folk alone!
Well, you're not helping me by being here, you stupid fox!
Don't move!
Shikigami Kuzunoha, I order you to scatter the jufu you possess and flee our foes! Onmyo!
Argh! My body's movin' all on its own! Don't do it, Lord Seimei! I don't wanna be runnin' away without ya!
Go find something even a useless idiot like you can do—I'm counting on you.
Lord Seimeeeeei!
Thought I told you not to move.
You told ME not to move, but I don't think anyone mentioned it to my stupid fox.
You think you're so smart, don't you?
Heh. We're gonna enjoy this...
*pant* *pant* I can finally move on my own again...
(I gotta get back to Lord Seimei! It's all my fault, so I gotta be the one what makes everything right again!)
(Please be safe, master!)
Lord Seimei?! Lord Seimei, I'm here!
Huh? There ain't no one here.
I'm too late... Oh, what've I done?
Hoo boy. What a mess.
Lady Mitsuhide? Gozu? What're y'all doin' here?
I just happened to run into Gozu Tenno, and when I told him you were planning an assault, he asked me to take him here.
Never thought we'd arrive to find Seimei abducted by the Mukuroshu.
It's all my fault—I went and ignored what he told me to do.
Yeah, I figure things would have played out differently if he'd come alone.
This is what happens when you try to do something that's beyond you by yourself. Right, Gozu Tenno?
Erk. Well...
Still, a subordinate's failing reflects on the boss—Seimei must have known this was a distinct possibility.
And since our Wyrmclans are rivals for the position of shogun, I've got no duty to help him out of this particular jam.
So if you've got nothing else to say, I'm going to take a nap and wait for all this to play out.
It's my responsibility, which means I gotta set things right by m'own self!
Okay, I said I wasn't going to get involved, but I reeeally don't think Seimei wants you to feel that kind of obligation.
I reckon that's true.
The last time you charged into danger like a maniac, I asked if you could really handle it all alone. Remember?
That's not something I would have said to Seimei, because I honestly think that guy is capable of anything he sets his mind to.
But YOU? You're a big ol' klutz and a half, and you really need to accept that.
Still, being a klutz doesn't mean there's nothing you can do in this situation.
Well, you're not helping me by being here, you stupid fox!
Go find something even a useless idiot like you can do—I'm counting on you.
...Yer right. I can't do nothin' on m'own, 'cause I'm just a useless fox.
But Lord Seimei's countin' on me, and just 'cause I can't do nothin' on m'own don't mean I can't do nothin' at all!
Please, Lady Mitsuhide! Ya gotta help me save him! Ya just gotta!
Oh, fine. Why not? Having Seimei in my debt might even be fun.
You have my aid as well, for my intent was to save Lord Seimei from the first.
Aw, yer both just the best!
So what's our first move? It doesn't look like the enemy's been gone for very long.
Still, there's no guarantee we'll find anything useful just looking around, and I can't reeeally be bothered, so...
Lord Seimei is not the kind of person to let himself be captured without a plan.
I am certain he will have left some manner of clue to aid us.
All I see are a boatload of jufu scattered all over the floor.
Wait... I know how to find him!
Go on.
See, I can detonate them jufu there and make 'em stun enemies with bright light and crazy noise and the like.
Is that not the same skill you were practicing with Lord Seimei this morning? I recall it going...not well.
Look, just put that in the ol' dustbin. Right now, we gotta focus on the jufu on the floor there.
I know I scattered more of 'em than that, which means Lord Seimei likely managed to grab a few before bein' hauled off.
And you think you can detonate them from afar to learn his location?
So long as they're somewhere my mana can reach, yer sure as shootin' I can!
I can vouch for this; I was a victim of such just this morning.
Aw, I'm awful sorry 'bout that.
Well, if you can do it, let's stop talking about it and just get it done already.
We need to try it before the Mukuroshu take Seimei and the jufu out of range.
So Gozu Tenno and I just go outside and listen for the detonation, right?
That's right!
If this can lead us to Lord Seimei, I will gladly try. Let us be off.
*pant* *pant* I'm gonna show everyone there ARE things I can do!
O that which shines like the darn sun! I beseech ya, release yer light'n make manifest its brilliance! Onmyo! Haaaah!
*cough* *cough* Aw, horseshoes. I failed again. ...But I ain't givin' up!
Yeee-haw! I did it! It blowed up but good! Now we can find Lord Seimei!
Hang in there, Lord Seimei! I'll be there before you know it!
Judging by the direction of the sound and the faintly remaining smoke, Lord Seimei should be in this area!
Knowing him, he's probably taken advantage of the explosion to start causing new trouble.
He always has to do everything himself!
There! I see him!
Eeeeek! Not again!
Would you please cram it already?
LORD SEIMEI!
Well, well. Look who finally showed up. ...What'd you bring the lazy mouse for?
Oh, she insisted she wanted my help, and I thought it was a very nice chance to put you in my debt.
If you want me to feel like I owe you, you'd better put the work in.
Nah, I'm good. I'm just gonna protect the lady over there while you do your thing.
*sigh* You are so hard to read.
I'll give that big one to you, Gozu Tenno.
As you wish, my lord.
You ready for a fight, Kuzunoha?
You were right about me all along, master. I ain't like you, and I ain't no help to nobody what when I'm by m'lonesome.
I know I caused more trouble'n a newborn bull in a surgery clinic, but I still wanna help ya if'n I can!
Heh. Then give it your best shot.
Yeee-haw! Let's do this!
*pant* *pant*
O that which shines like the darn sun! I beseech ya, release yer light'n make manifest its brilliance! Onmyo! Haaaah!
Heh. Not bad.
Perhaps you're not completely useless by yourself after all.
Sorry, what's that, master? M'ears are still ringin'.
Bah. I was telling you not to let one victory go to your fuzzy head!
That there's a right mean thing to be sayin'... Hee hee!
What are you grinning about? Stop that. It creeps me out.
'Member how I said I can't never be like ya, master?
Well, now I feel like if I keep tryin', one day I WILL be just like ya!
Get that idiotic idea right out of your head. You'll need to do a lot more than this to even approach my level.
Still, ain't no harm in a fox dreamin', am I right?
Look, I was just so darn desperate to be useful that I let m'self get carried away.
But I'm a stubborn ol' critter, so I kept right on tryin'—and that darn near got a lot'a good folk hurt.
So I know there's stuff even an stupid fox like me can do—I just gotta find it.
Anyway, while I look for that, I promise not to cause ya more trouble by tryin' to get too big for m'britches.
Exactly—you don't need to be me. If you want to be my assistant, you just need to find ways to be USEFUL.
Y'mean...I'm yer assistant again?! For reals?!
Sorry to disturb this tender moment.
Lady Mitsuhide?! Why're you here?!
I came to report to Seimei about the Mukuroshu.
Oh, right. Gozu took 'em all somewhere after we beat 'em down, didn't he?
Yeah. I was hoping we'd be able to get something useful out of them, but...
But what?
But they died before they could talk.
What?! We didn't hardly scratch 'em!
It was not us. It was Doman's curse, presumably.
So you knew this would happen?
Do you really think I would have foreseen this and just let our only leads up and die?
So what's all this chitter and chatter 'bout some kinda curse?
A curse on his followers that takes their lives if they ever attempt to reveal information about him would be a simple thing for an onmyoji as capable as he.
Those Mukuroshu said they borrowed shikigami from Doman, so I'm guessing the curse was placed in that moment.
But how could he do somethin' so dang cruel to his own allies?
He doesn't see them as allies any more than a chess master grows fond of pawns.
Hmph. Don't look so glum.
We dismantled one of their bases; that's enough achievement for one day.
And I helped out my people!
Yeah, I s'pose it's nice the folk here don't need to worry about bein' stolen from their beds no more.
That reminds me: There's something I need to show you, Seimei.
A map? But what do all the numbers and symbols represent?
They show trends in the number of people disappearing in each district. I looked into it while dealing with all the trouble the Mukuroshu stirred up.
See how a few of them have weird spikes compared to last year?
Meaning if we follow the spikes, we can find the Mukuroshu.
Can't be sure, but it seems likely. Better than stumbling around in the dark, at any rate, so...good luck!
I take it your part in this little adventure has come to a close, then?
Like I said, I just wanted to save my own people.
Traveling miles to help others isn't my idea of a good time—I leave THAT to you.
Why do I get the feeling I'm being used...? Bah. Fine. Have it your way.
Come, Kuzunoha. We're leaving.
What, now?! But we ain't ready!
Then GET us ready! That's an assistant's job!
Yes, master! Right away, master! I'll get us readier than a farmer at the first day'a spring!
*sigh* I wish I could trust that.
The cuss does that mean?!
Never mind. Let's just get going.
Wait for me, Lord Seimei! Waaaaait!
